headline: QUALCOMM Q1 Earnings Call Highlights
summary: QUALCOMM (NASDAQ:QCOM) reported record results for its fiscal first quarter of 2026, highlighted by $12.3 billion in revenue and non-GAAP earnings per share of $3.50, as management pointed to strength in flagship smartphones alongside continued growth in automotive and improving momentum across port

headline: Qualcomm, Arm bear brunt of memory shortage as smartphone chip sales disappoint
summary: Memory shortages will constrain sales of cell phones for some time, hurting demand for chip industry companies like supplier Qualcomm and chip ​architecture designer Arm Holdings, executives and analysts said on Wednesday as both companies reported results that ‌disappointed investors.  Among the world's largest smartphone chip designers, Qualcomm is dealing with relatively tepid orders as customers fail to secure memory allocations ‌to ship complete products, resulting in the company forecasting revenue in the current quarter below market estimates.  "Industry-wide memory shortage and price increases are likely to define the overall scale of the handset industry through the fiscal year," Qualcomm CEO Cristiano Amon said during a post-earnings call.

thumbnail.caption: FILE PHOTO: Qualcomm shares slide as memory chip shortage hits smartphone market

headline: Bitcoin slips below $71,000 as AI-driven tech rout worsens
summary: The decline followed sharp losses in Asian and U.S. tech shares, where concerns over peaking AI investment, stretched valuations and slowing earnings have driven investors out of risk assets.

content.title: Bitcoin slips below $71,000 as AI-driven tech rout worsens

headline: The Bull Case For QUALCOMM (QCOM) Could Change Following Cautious Outlook On Memory‑Driven Handset Constraints
summary: In early February 2026, Qualcomm reported fiscal first-quarter 2026 results showing revenue of US$12.25 billion and net income of US$3.00 billion, alongside guidance pointing to weaker second-quarter revenue and earnings due to a global memory shortage constraining smartphone customers. While Qualcomm highlighted record quarterly sales and progress in areas such as automotive, IoT, and AI-focused initiatives, management’s emphasis on industry-wide memory supply and pricing pressures...
